name: BitByte Defender
description:
Survive hordes of Monsters in BitByte Defender! 

Hello? Is this thing on?

Oh good. Hello. As Teal Hill Zone Campsite Coordinator, it's my job to update you with what you need to know. Purely on a need-to-know basis of course.

A truck carrying radioactive waste has crashed near the Teal Hill Zone Campsite, and everyone has mutated into horrible Monsters! Everyone that is, except you!

You've developed Psychic powers from exposure to the toxic waste, and now it's your duty as Camp Officer to clean up the campsite!

Harness powerful weapons such as guns, and more guns, and even more guns. Oh, and saw blades!

Monsters drop Bits when defeated, collect enough, and the research team at Teal Hills Zone Campsite will upgrade your equipment and give you cool new abilities! Why do we have a research team?  Because there's research to do!

Be careful, it looks like Monsters get stronger the longer they're exposed to the waste, so keep your wits about you, collect Bits, and survive!

Upgrades Blue

These upgrades benefit your main gun. That's the one you point and shoot with.

Yellow

Yellow Bits can be traded in for sentry guns and their upgrades! These bad boys orbit around you firing at any Monster nearby. Or anything really. They just fire.

Red

We found these saw blades with faces on them, and we figured you could trade your Red Bits in for these and use your Psychic abilities to form a shield. The lab boys think they might be sentient, and if so, they seem to be pretty shy, so you might need to coax them out. But when they're out, oh boy...

Purple

Now listen closely. Purple Bits have the closest DNA to humans than any other Bit. Yes, Bits have DNA, don't question it. Anyway, use these Purple Bits to get upgrades for you. Yes, YOU! You deserve it!

Controls

Use the WASD keys to move around, and aim with the Mouse Cursor. I don't know what that means, but the lab boys tell me it makes sense. Your gun will auto fire for you, no more carpal tunnel syndrome!

Note

We've got some readings from the lab saying, hold on... "Due to the nature of the radioactive material outside Teal Hill Zone Campsite, reality itself has began to corrupt".  Sounds like scaremongering to me, I wouldn't worry about it. But if you do notice 'reality itself corrupting', don't panic. I imagine this would include:

  • Starting a second run doesn't work. To play again, reload the page.
  • The player might occasionally move across the map.
  • Some high score text might not update properly.
  • Collisions may be missed occasionally.
